basis: User expresses a concrete, time-bound plan (6:00 PM today, 40 ml sip, log afterward) and explicitly states reliance on external prompts. This aligns closely with the suggested tiny-step approach, indicating high likelihood they will execute the planned action.
cognitive_dissonance: Moderate: anxiety about eating conflicts with a strong desire to follow a tiny, structured plan. The user compensates by pre-committing to log and by opting for external prompts to reduce self-pressure.
negative_thought_patterns: Anxiety-focused beliefs about eating; worries about overwhelm; potential catastrophizing about meals; fear of not following through.
emotional_triggers: Heat/physical discomfort, anxiety around eating, need for structure and external prompts, desire for reassurance via reminders.
coaching_notes: Keep leveraging ultra-tiny, self-paced steps and reliable reminders. Validate anxiety, avoid pressure, and provide easy fallback options (log an attempted sip). Encourage logging even if only an attempted sip to maintain momentum. Maintain a gentle, flexible cadence and celebrate small wins.
